definition: to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: Mordo takes his power and says there's too many sorcerers in the world.
sentences.chinese: 莫度奪走了潘伯恩的法力，說世界上的魔法師太多了。

sentences.english: Komodo dragon, by the way, why does man have to take him all away?
sentences.chinese: 順便說說，科莫多龍。爲什麼人們都要奪走你的生命？

sentences.english: Experts estimate that the high-speed railway will take 30 percent of passengers from airlines.
sentences.chinese: 專家預計，高鐵將會奪走航空市場30%的客源。

sentences.english: A German grenade had taken three fingers off his left hand.
sentences.chinese: 德國人的手榴彈奪走了他左手的三根手指。

sentences.english: It cannot be taken from you, not by angels or by demons, heaven or hell.
sentences.chinese: 天使或魔鬼，天堂或地域都無法從你這裏奪走它。

sentences.english: He was carried away by the plague.
Growth is a cruel plunder, rob to naive, take pure.
sentences.chinese: 成長是一場殘忍的掠奪，搶去天真，奪走單純。
癌症奪走了許多人的生命。

sentences.english: Tell me, who makes me miss him every night?
sentences.chinese: 是誰奪走了我一夜夜的思念？

sentences.english: HuJi and don't want to kill him, she hated the ghost killed when my heart.
sentences.chinese: 胡姬並不想殺死問天，她恨時幽冥奪走了本人的心。

sentences.english: The thief despoiled the old man of his belongings.
sentences.chinese: 賊奪走了那老人的財物。

sentences.english: But the concrete that covered him would not, could not kill him.
sentences.chinese: 但是壓在他身上的鋼筋混凝土不會奪走他的生命。

sentences.english: Howell was in misery. She’d robbed him of whatever little thunder he had left.
sentences.chinese: 豪厄爾痛苦地聽着，她把他所剩不多的光芒都奪走了。

sentences.english: A great divide but this man held my gaze across the distance.
sentences.chinese: 人羣分割了我們，但那個男人奪走了我的凝望。

sentences.english: The man would probably seize him by the wrist and take the razor away.
sentences.chinese: 那人很可能會抓住他的手腕，把刮鬍刀奪走。
